labels.analysis: The MCP Server described focuses on providing access to aviation-specific data and tools through a standardized protocol. Its primary functionality revolves around querying and retrieving aviation-related information, particularly flight delays and compensation eligibility. The available tools specifically target real-time checks for flight delay compensation under different regulatory frameworks (e.g., AviationStack API, Canadian APPR regulations). This suggests the server is designed to enhance aviation workflows by integrating real-time and static aviation data into AI-driven environments.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Aviation Services" is assigned because the server's core functionality is centered around aviation-specific tools and data, which isn't fully covered by any of the predefined categories. The secondary label "API Integration" is relevant because the server uses external APIs (like AviationStack) to provide its services. The "Travel & Maps" category is also applicable due to the server's focus on flight-related data. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately represent its functionality.

tools.name: flight-delay-compensation-check
tools.description: Checks if a flight qualifies for delay compensation using AviationStack API

tools.name: canadian-flight-delay-compensation
tools.description: Checks if a flight qualifies for compensation under Canadian APPR regulations

server_info_crawled.name: Aviation Data Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @SettledCo/mcp-aviation-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide seamless access to aviation-related data and tools through a standardized protocol. Enable LLM applications to query, retrieve, and interact with aviation resources efficiently. Enhance aviation workflows by integrating real-time and static aviation information into AI-driven environments.

tools.name: flight-delay-compensation-check
tools.description: Checks if a flight qualifies for delay compensation using AviationStack API

tools.name: canadian-flight-delay-compensation
tools.description: Checks if a flight qualifies for compensation under Canadian APPR regulations

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@SettledCo/mcp-aviation-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
